* The Parser class that parses user inputs
* Parses a string input and returns a corresponding Command object.
* @param input the user input with type String.
public static Optional<Command> parse(String input) throws Exception {
Ui.printError(new Exception("A word of bye is enough"));

Ui.printError(new Exception("More content than needed for done task"));

throw new Exception("A tad too few words, innit? ");
* The Storage class that handles storage related businesses for the Duke program.
* Constructs a Storage object with the specified file path.
* @param filePath the file path to the file that stores data for the Duke program.
* Scans the file specified by the file path and output a list of Task objects.
* @return An ArrayList collection of Task objects.
* Writes the list of Task objects into the file specified by the file path.
* @param lst An ArrayList collection of Task objects.
System.out.println("Greeting, traveler. My name is Andrew. What can I do for you?");
System.out.println("I shall not trouble you anymore. Farewell, partner.");
* Prints a message when an addition command is completed.
* @param str  a String description of the task.
* @param size the number of Task objects in the current list after the addition.
public static void printAdd(String str, int size) {
System.out.printf("You now have %d tasks in your list\n", size);
* Prints a message when a deletion command is completed
* @param str  a String description of the task.
* @param size the number of Task objects in the current list after the deletion.
public static void printDel(String str, int size) {
System.out.printf("Your burden has been lifted, removed: \n\t %s\n", str);
System.out.printf("You now have %d tasks in your list\n", size);
* Prints a message when a done command is completed
* @param str  a String description of the task
* @param size the number of Task objects in the current list after the completion.
public static void printDone(String str, int size) {
System.out.printf("You now have %d tasks in your list\n", size);
* Prints a message when a find command is initiated.
System.out.printf("Tasks that contain %s in your list\n", str);
* Prints a message showing the number of matches found.
* Prints all the available commands that the Duke program can understand.
System.out.println("1. event [description] : add a new event");
System.out.println("2. deadline [description] by yyyy-mm-dd hhmm : add a new deadline");
System.out.println("3. todo [description] at yyyy-mm-dd hhmm : add a new todo");
System.out.println("4. done [index] : complete the task at given index");
System.out.println("5. delete [index] : delete the task at given index");
System.out.println("6. find [one single keyword] : find records that contain the specified keyword");
System.out.println("7. bye : say goodbye and quit");
* A class representing an addition command.
* Constructs an AddCommand object with a specified Task object.
* @param task a Task object to be added by Duke.
* Executes this AddCommand and writes the specified task represented by the Task object to the file that is
* currently specified by the file path in the Duke instance.
* @param storage           an ArrayList collection of Task objects for processing in-program.
public boolean execute(Storage storageController, ArrayList<Task> storage) {
* An abstract object representing a command to the Duke program
* Executes a command using the specified Storage object and an ArrayList collection of Task objects.
* @param storage           an ArrayList collection of Task objects for processing in-program.
* @return true if the Command is an ExitCommand, false otherwise.
public abstract boolean execute(Storage storageController, ArrayList<Task> storage);
* A class representing a deletion command.
* Constructs the DeleteCommand object with specified index for deletion i.
* @param i a nonnegative, integer index for a Task object in the currently processed ArrayList.
* Executes this DeleteCommand. The Task object is deleted from the file specified by the file path in the current
* @param storage           an ArrayList collection of Task objects for processing in-program.
public boolean execute(Storage storageController, ArrayList<Task> storage) {
* A class representing a completion command.
* Constructs the DeleteCommand object with specified index for completion i.
* @param i a nonnegative, integer index for a Task object in the currently processed ArrayList.
* @param storage           an ArrayList collection of Task objects for processing in-program.
public boolean execute(Storage storageController, ArrayList<Task> storage) {
* A class representing an exit command.
* Exits the program by returning a true value that will be propagated upward.
* @param storage           an ArrayList collection of Task objects for processing in-program.
public boolean execute(Storage storageController, ArrayList<Task> storage) {
* A class representing a find command.
* Constructs the FindCommand object with a specified keyword.
* @param keyword a String value for the keyword.
* Displays the list of tasks that contain the query keyword. The list is consistent with data stored in the record
* specified by the file path in the current Duke instance.
* @param storage           an ArrayList collection of Task objects for processing in-program.
public boolean execute(Storage storageController, ArrayList<Task> storage) {
* A class representing a listing command.
* Displays the current list of tasks. The list is consistent with data stored in the record specified by the file
* path in the current Duke instance.
* @param storage           an ArrayList collection of Task objects for processing in-program.
public boolean execute(Storage storageController, ArrayList<Task> storage) {
* A class that represents a task with a deadline.

throw new Exception("Deadline tasks must have a non-empty description!");

throw new Exception("Event tasks must have a non-empty description!");
throw new Exception("Error: unable to decipher date & time input.");
* Returns the String representation of this EventTask object.
* @return the String representation of this EventTask object.

* @return type of the Task object with type String.

throw new Exception("You might have been mistaken. This task has already been completed.");
* Generates a Task object based on the input. The Task object can be a DeadlineTask, an EventTask, or a TodoTask.
* @param inputAsArray a String array representing the input to create the Task object.
* @throws Exception if the task type is invalid.
public static Task generateTask(String[] inputAsArray) throws Exception {
throw new Exception("You might have not chosen a valid task type! Valid types are events, todos, and deadlines");
* A task to be done that has no time attribute.

* Returns the String representation of this TodoTask object.
* @return the String representation of this TodoTask object.
